required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reactions to Reduced Nicotine Cigarettes in Young Adult Low-Frequency Smokers
clinical_study.official_title: Reactions to Reduced Nicotine Cigarettes in Young Adult Low-Frequency Smokers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate reactions to, and choices to self-administer, cigarette smoke with varying nicotine content among low-frequency, non-dependent adolescent/young adult smokers between the ages of 18-25 years.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will undergo three sessions in which their reactions to fixed doses of smoke from investigational cigarettes with three different nicotine contents (15.8 mg/gram of tobacco, 2.5 mg/g, and .4 mg/g) will be assessed. Following the third fixed-dose session, participants will return to the lab to choose one of the cigarettes to self-administer.

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective reactions to fixed doses of tobacco smoke
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after puff administration of each study cigarette
primary_outcome.description: Smoking Effects Questionnaire ratings following administration of puffs for NNC, INC, and VLNC cigarettes

primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after sampling all 3 study cigarettes
primary_outcome.description: Participants will choose which of the three cigarettes they prefer to smoke by ranking each of the three cigarette conditions using a 1-3 scale where 1 is the cigarette that they most desire to smoke and 3 is the cigarette that they least desire to smoke.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after puff administration of each study cigarette
secondary_outcome.description: The Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after puff administration of each study cigarette

secondary_outcome.measure: Smoking topography - Change in Carbon Monoxide (CO) values (in parts per million, ppm) following puff administration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after puff administration of each study cigarette
secondary_outcome.description: CO values (in ppm) will be obtained using a handheld CO monitor prior to puff administration and 5 minutes after completion of cigarette puff administration. The difference in values will provide a CO boost value

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During self-administration of chosen cigarette at the last experimental session (approximately over 10 minutes)
During self-administration of chosen cigarette at the last experimental session (approximately over 10 minutes)
secondary_outcome.description: Interpuff interval (in seconds) will be calculated using video recordings of self-administration of chosen cigarette

arm_group.description: Normal Nicotine Content (NNC), Intermediate Nicotine Content (INC), Very Low Nicotine Content (VLNC)
Normal Nicotine Content, Very Low Nicotine Content, Intermediate Nicotine Content
Intermediate Nicotine Content, Very Low Nicotine Content, Normal Nicotine Content
Intermediate Nicotine Content, Normal Nicotine Content, Very Low Nicotine Content
Very Low Nicotine Content, Normal Nicotine Content, Intermediate Nicotine Content
Very Low Nicotine Content, Intermediate Nicotine Content, Normal Nicotine Content

intervention.description: cigarettes with 0.03 nicotine yield with 0.4 mg/g nicotine content and 9.0 mg tar yield
cigarettes with 0.12 nicotine yield with 2.4 mg/g nicotine content and 9.0 mg tar yield
cigarettes with 0.8 nicotine yield with 15.8 mg/g nicotine content and 10.5 mg tar yield

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- generally healthy
- between the ages of 18-25
- use nicotine or tobacco products between 1-15 days/month for at least 6 months
- smokes at least 10 cigarettes/month
- no unstable or significant medical or psychiatric conditions
- breath alcohol value=0.000
- able to provide contact information for two individuals who can corroborate smoking status
Exclusion Criteria:
- use of illegal drugs as measured by urine drug screen (excluding THC)
- serious quit attempt in the past 3 months
- plans to quit smoking in the next 2 months
- current use of nicotine replacement therapy or other tobacco cessation products
- inability to attend all required experimental sessions
- blood pressure >160/100 mmHg
- pregnant, trying to become pregnant, or breastfeeding
